alert.note: Alert for Henderson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 09 at 2:52AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Indiana and western Kentucky, including the following counties, in Indiana, Gibson, Posey and Vanderburgh. In western Kentucky, Henderson. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 149 AM CST, The heavy rainfall has ended and no further heavy rain is expected. Flood Waters will need a little longer to recede. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Evansville, Mount Vernon, Haubstadt, Darmstadt, Poseyville, Cynthiana, Blairsville, Kasson and Griffin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
